column4: Still having issues with my desktop system flaking out when connecting to a wireless network... anyone?
how are you connected to wireless? is it USB or PCI?
USB. I can establish a connection, obtain an ip address, then ping google (or other site) about three times before it stops transmitting/receiving data
pastebin your lsusb output with the USB dongle
http://pastebin.org/481444
and you're using the latest ubuntu?
Yep.
pastebin your dmesg output
Not sure why it's failing, I've used this dongle before with no trouble.
it could be issue with the driver I'm thinking, which might be solved with using linux-backports
I'll grab that dmesg and pastebin it then... Half a mo'.
http://pastebin.org/481459
It is reporting the correct mac address, just blotted that bit out.
which driver are you using on the desktop? rt2x00?
Not sure offhand, what's the best way to check?
lsmod| grep rt2x00
Looks like it.
so the command line says there's rt2x00? hmm ok I'd try linux-backports
Where can I grab the package I need so I can install it locally on that machine? (No net access otherwise for the desktop.)
I believe its from the ubuntu repository but it may have dependencies in which you'll need to grab as well, its probably a good idea to physically connect your desktop to the router via wired
That's the problem. Bad eth port on the hardware.
well I don't have much other suggestions :) a wired network card costs almost like nothing, maybe a good idea to invest in one
Thanks for helping with troubleshooting the cause. :)
the other is to downgrade I suppose, its probably an issue with kernel afaik
